Package org.microbean.type

Class Types

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.type.Types
  • public final class Types
extends Object
    A hub for Java Type-related operations.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    toTypes(Type)
    Thread Safety:
    Instances of this class are safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • Method Detail

      • normalize

        public static final Type normalize​(Type type)
        For the vast majority of cases, returns the supplied Type unchanged, but in the case where a raw Class is supplied, returns an equivalent ParameterizedType whose actual type arguments are not resolved.
        Parameters:
        type - the Type to normalize; may be null in which case null will be returned; will often be returned unchanged
        Returns:
        the normalized Type; null if type was null
        Nullability:
        This method may return null only if the supplied Type is null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • isRawType

        public static final boolean isRawType​(Type type)
        Returns true if and only if the supplied Type is a raw type according to the rules of the Java Language Specification.

        This method returns true if:

        • The supplied Type is an instance of Class, and any of the following conditions is true:
          • The return value of invoking this method on the class's component type is true
          • The class has type parameters
        Parameters:
        type - the Type in question; may be null in which case false will be returned
        Returns:
        true if and only if the supplied Type is a raw Class
        See Also:
        The Java Language Specification Section 4.8

      • isGeneric

        public static final boolean isGeneric​(Class<?> cls)
        Returns true if and only if the supplied Class is generic according to the rules of the Java Language Specification.
        Parameters:
        cls - the Class in question; may be null in which case false will be returned
        Returns:
        true if the supplied Class is non- null and returns an array with more than zero elements from an invocation of its Class.getTypeParameters() method; false otherwise
        See Also:
        Class.getTypeParameters(), The Java Language Specification Section 8.1.2

      • isReferenceType

        public static final boolean isReferenceType​(Type type)
        Returns true if and only if the supplied Type represents a reference type according to the rules of the Java Language Specification.
        Parameters:
        type - the Type in question; may be null in which case false will be returned
        Returns:
        true if and only if the supplied Type represents a reference type according to the rules of the Java Language Specification
        See Also:
        The Java Language Specification Section 4.3

      • resolve

        public static final Type resolve​(Type type,
                                 Function<? super Type,​? extends Type> typeResolver)
        Resolves the supplied Type and returns the result, or the Type itself if the Type could not be resolved.

        Type resolution is delegated to the supplied Function which is most commonly a method reference to the Map.get(Object) method of a Map<Type, Type>. Generally speaking, however, the type resolver may take any side-effect-free action it wishes.

        Parameters:
        type - the Type to resolve; may be null
        typeResolver - the Function whose Function.apply(Object) method will be called on, among other things, ParameterizedType type arguments; must not be null; may return null; will never be supplied with a null Type
        Returns:
        the resolved Type, or null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if typeResolver is null
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent and deterministic.
        Nullability:
        This method will return null only when the supplied Type is null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • toTypes

        public static final TypeSet toTypes​(Type type)
        Returns a non-null, unmodifiable Set of Types, each element of which is a Type which any instance bearing the supplied Type will implement.

        The Set that is returned is guaranteed to not contain WildcardType or TypeVariable instances.

        Parameters:
        type - the Type whose type closure should be computed; may be null
        Returns:
        a non-null TypeSet; the supplied Type will be one of its elements unless it is a TypeVariable or a WildcardType
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent.
        Nullability:
        This method never returns null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • toTypes

        public static final TypeSet toTypes​(Type type,
                                    Predicate<? super Type> removalPredicate)
        Returns a non-null, unmodifiable Set of Types, each element of which is a Type which any instance bearing the supplied Type will implement.

        The Set that is returned is guaranteed to not contain WildcardType or TypeVariable instances.

        If the supplied Predicate returns true from an invocation of its Predicate.test(Object) method, then the Type that was passed to it will not be contained by the returned TypeSet.

        Parameters:
        type - the Type whose type closure should be computed; may be null
        removalPredicate - a Predicate used to selectively remove some Types from the computed TypeSet; may be null
        Returns:
        a non-null TypeSet, filtered by the supplied Predicate
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent.
        Nullability:
        This method never returns null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • box

        public static final <T extends Type> T box​(T type)
        Returns the result of boxing conversion on the supplied Type.

        In most cases this means the supplied Type is returned unchanged.

        This method calls isPrimitive(Type) as part of its execution.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the kind of Type in question
        Parameters:
        type - the Type to test
        Returns:
        the result of boxing conversion on the supplied Type
        See Also:
        isPrimitive(Type), The Java Language Specification Section 5.1.7
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent and deterministic.
        Nullability:
        This method will return null if type is null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • isPrimitive

        public static final boolean isPrimitive​(Type type)
        Returns true if and only if type is a Class and is primitive.

        Design Notes

        This prosaic method exists because various Predicates need to exist that test this very thing, and making it public does no harm.

        Parameters:
        type - the Type to test; may be null in which case false will be returned
        Returns:
        true if and only if type is a Class and is primitive
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent and deterministic.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • isClass

        public static final boolean isClass​(Type type)
        Returns true if the supplied Type is an instance of Class.

        Design Notes

        This prosaic method exists because various Predicates need to exist that test this very thing, and making it public does no harm.

        Parameters:
        type - the Type in question; may be null in which case false will be returned
        Returns:
        true if and only if type is an instance of Class
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent and deterministic.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • erase

        public static final Class<?> erase​(Type type)
        Returns the type erasure for the supplied Type according to the rules of the Java Language Specification.
        • If null is supplied, null is returned.
        • If a Class is supplied, the Class is returned.
        • If a ParameterizedType is supplied, the result of invoking erase(Type) on its raw type is returned.
        • If a GenericArrayType is supplied, the result of invoking Object.getClass() on an invocation of Array.newInstance(Class, int) with the return value of an invocation of erase(Type) on its generic component type and 0 as its arguments is returned.
        • If a TypeVariable is supplied, the result of invoking erase(Type) on its first (leftmost) bound is returned (if it has one) or Object.class if it does not. Any other bounds are ignored.
        • If a WildcardType is supplied, the result of invoking erase(Type) on its first upper bound is returned. Any other bounds are ignored.
        Parameters:
        type - the Type for which the corresponding type erasure is to be returned; may be null in which case null will be returned
        Returns:
        a Class, or null if a suitable type erasure could not be determined
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent and deterministic.
        Nullability:
        This method may return null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by mutltiple threads.

      • getEffectiveBounds

        public static final Type[] getEffectiveBounds​(TypeVariable<?> type)
        Returns the effective bounds of the supplied TypeVariable.

        The effective bounds of a TypeVariable are one of the following:

        • The (recursive) effective bounds of its sole TypeVariable-typed bound
        • Its non-TypeVariable-typed bounds
        Parameters:
        type - the TypeVariable in question; must not be null
        Returns:
        a non-null array of Types representing the supplied TypeVariable's effective bounds with one or more elements
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if type is null
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent and deterministic.
        Nullability:
        This method never returns null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • toSerializableType

        public static final <T extends Serializable & Type> T toSerializableType​(Type type)
        Returns a Serializable Type that represents the supplied Type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a Serializable Type
        Parameters:
        type - the Type in question; may be null in which case null will be returned
        Returns:
        a Serializable version of the supplied Type
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if type is non- null and is not an instance of Serializable, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType, TypeVariable or WildcardType
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent and deterministic.
        Nullability:
        This method will return null only when the supplied Type is null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • hashCode

        public static final int hashCode​(Type type)
        Computes and returns a hashcode for the supplied Type independent of its implementation.
        Parameters:
        type - the Type in question; may be null in which case 0 will be returned
        Returns:
        a hashcode for the supplied Type
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent and deterministic.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • equals

        public static final boolean equals​(Type type0,
                                   Type type1)
        Tests two Types for equality in a manner that is independent of their implementations.
        Parameters:
        type0 - the first Type; may be null
        type1 - the second Type; may be null
        Returns:
        true if the two Types are equal; false otherwise
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent and deterministic.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      • toString

        public static final String toString​(Type type)
        Returns a String representation of the supplied Type that is independent of its implementation.

        This method never returns null.

        Parameters:
        type - the Type in question; may be null in which case "null" will be returned
        Returns:
        a non-null String representation of the supplied Type
        Idempotency:
        This method is idempotent and deterministic.
        Nullability:
        This method never returns null.
        Thread Safety:
        This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
